title: A Guide to Stoicism

text: An intense practicality was a mark of the later Greek philosophy.
title: A Guide to Stoicism
author: Stock, St. George William Joseph

text: This was common to Stoicism with its rival Epicureanism. Both
title: A Guide to Stoicism
author: Stock, St. George William Joseph

text: regarded philosophy as 'the art of life,' though they differed in
title: A Guide to Stoicism
author: Stock, St. George William Joseph

text: their conception of what that art should be. Widely as the two
title: A Guide to Stoicism
author: Stock, St. George William Joseph

text: schools were opposed to one another, they had also other features in
title: A Guide to Stoicism
author: Stock, St. George William Joseph

text: common. Both were children of an age in which the free city had given
title: A Guide to Stoicism
author: Stock, St. George William Joseph

text: way to monarchies, and personal had taken the place of corporate
title: A Guide to Stoicism
author: Stock, St. George William Joseph

text: life. The question of happiness is no longer, as with Aristotle, and
title: A Guide to Stoicism
author: Stock, St. George William Joseph

text: still more with Plato, one for the state, but for the individual. In
title: A Guide to Stoicism
author: Stock, St. George William Joseph

title: A Guide to Stoicism
author: Stock, St. George William Joseph

text: tended to become feebler as time went on. Both were new departures
title: A Guide to Stoicism
author: Stock, St. George William Joseph

title: A Guide to Stoicism
author: Stock, St. George William Joseph

title: A Guide to Stoicism
author: Stock, St. George William Joseph

title: A Guide to Stoicism

title: A Guide to Stoicism

title: A Guide to Stoicism
author: Stock, St. George William Joseph

title: A Guide to Stoicism
author: Stock, St. George William Joseph

title: A Guide to Stoicism

title: A Guide to Stoicism

title: A Guide to Stoicism

title: A Guide to Stoicism

title: A Guide to Stoicism

title: A Guide to Stoicism

title: A Guide to Stoicism
